Intel Corporation ESG Report – 2023
Intel Corp. remains steadfast in embedding Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles across its core business strategy. In 2023, the company achieved significant milestones in carbon reduction, workforce diversity, ethical governance, and stakeholder engagement. This report outlines Intel’s progress, challenges, and future goals in alignment with key global frameworks including the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB), and Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD).

Environmental Stewardship
Intel reduced its Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 20% from a 2020 baseline, primarily due to enhanced operational energy efficiency and an increase in renewable energy procurement. All emissions disclosures align with the GHG Protocol Corporate Standard, and emission factors are regionally adjusted.
The company invested $50 million in energy efficiency upgrades and committed to achieving Net-Zero Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2040, exceeding the Paris Agreement timeline. In 2023, 65% of Intel’s global operations were powered by renewable energy (solar, wind, hydro), with plans to reach 80% by 2025.
Intel achieved zero waste-to-landfill status at eight major sites and improved water stewardship by reducing usage by 15%, enabled by closed-loop water recycling systems. In the area of supply chain sustainability, 85% of tier-1 suppliers are now aligned with Intel’s Supplier ESG Code of Conduct. A new carbon tracking initiative for suppliers, aligned with Scope 3 emissions reporting, was rolled out in Q3 2023.
To address biodiversity and environmental compliance, Intel conducted Environmental Impact Assessments (EIAs) across its manufacturing hubs and maintained 100% compliance with local environmental regulations.

Social Responsibility
In 2023, Intel made substantial progress in advancing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI). 42% of leadership positions are held by women, and 40% of new hires are from historically underrepresented backgrounds. All employees completed mandatory unconscious bias and anti-discrimination training, which has been independently audited.
Intel launched a global mental health support program, leading to a 30% increase in employee wellbeing scores. Over 5,000 employees participated in digital upskilling programs, reflecting the company’s commitment to workforce development. Intel also contributed $25 million toward community investments in education, healthcare, and social infrastructure, and employees collectively volunteered over 50,000 hours.
The company implemented new Human Rights Due Diligence (HRDD) processes, focusing on risk mitigation in high-impact regions. Intel's grievance mechanism received zero unresolved labor rights complaints during the reporting period.

Governance and Ethics
Governance enhancements included the creation of an ESG Oversight Committee at the board level, ensuring accountability for climate, social, and ethical risks. The board achieved 45% diversity in gender and ethnicity. Intel’s Code of Conduct and Whistleblower Protection Policy were updated in 2023 and disseminated company-wide.
All employees underwent anti-corruption and ethics training, with a 100% completion rate, and there were zero material compliance breaches reported.
To strengthen data governance, Intel implemented a global data privacy framework aligned with GDPR and CCPA. This included Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) for all new data projects and led to the company's ISO/IEC 27701 certification for privacy management.
Cybersecurity measures were also significantly upgraded, achieving ISO 27001 certification, and leading to a 40% reduction in reported incidents year-over-year.

Looking Ahead: ESG Targets for 2024–2026
Intel is committed to the following forward-looking targets:
80% renewable energy usage across global operations by 2025.
50/50 gender parity in leadership by 2026.
30% reduction in Scope 3 emissions by 2026 through supply chain collaboration.
Launch of a global circular economy initiative to reduce product and packaging waste.
Integrating GRI 305, 403, and 102 standards into automated ESG assurance and auditing systems.

Conclusion
Intel's 2023 ESG report reflects its commitment to transparent reporting, ethical governance, environmental stewardship, and inclusive economic growth. The report has been prepared by the Sustainability/ESG Team in March 2025, and verified internally against the GRI Standards (2021 update) and cross-referenced with SASB metrics and TCFD guidance.
The company will continue to engage stakeholders and disclose progress annually, aligning its sustainability ambitions with a just, equitable, and climate-resilient future.
